divs: sighting detailsmy wife and i were at home on our back deck. we observed a large, very bright light moving from north to south over the northern section of hampton, va. two aircraft were in the vicinity but were much dimmer with strobing lights and appeared to be at a higher altitude. the aircraft were easily identifiable. the object we observed did not have strobe lights and the luminosity and intensity of the light did not correlate with aircraft landing lights (i am a retired nasa engineer). no sound was evident and it appeared to be at a lower altitude than the aircraft. we observed the light moving toward us for about 30 seconds at which time it instantly blinked out. no further lights were visible. we looked for signs of a moving object at the point it blinked out but none was observable. if it an aircraft which had turned off its landing lights we should have seen its strobes, particularly in the airspace it occupied which is relatively busy. the location of the sighting is near patrick henry airport in newport news, va, norfolk international airport in norfolk, va, and langley afb in hampton, va. what we observed was unusual, attention-getting, and has peaked our curiousity. we would like to know if others have reported this or if has been explained. one possible explanation would be that it was a stealth aircraft but, if so, it certainly should have had strobe lights on while operating in this airspace. in summary, this event was unusual enough that we felt it warranted reporting. we hope it is helpful to you. thank you. *(wit's name deleted--cms\sg).
Summary: observed very bright light, no strobe, quiet, blinked out
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Hampton
There were no other sightings in Hampton on or around November 12th 2010
